title: Anthropic
content:
{{Short description|Artificial intelligence research company}} {{Infobox company | name = Anthropic PBC | logo =File:Anthropic logo.svg | type = [[Privately held company|Private]] | industry = [[Artificial intelligence]] | founded = {{Start date and age|2021}} | founders = {{Unbulleted list| | Daniela Amodei | [[Dario Amodei]] | Jack Clark{{cite news |title=Alphabet-backed Anthropic outlines the moral values behind its AI bot |url=https://www.reuters.com/technology/alphabet-backed-anthropic-outlines-moral-values-behind-its-ai-bot-2023-05-09/ |website=[[Reuters]] |date=9 May 2023 |access-date=4 June 2023 |last1=Nellis |first1=Stephen |archive-date=5 June 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230605051105/https://www.reuters.com/technology/alphabet-backed-anthropic-outlines-moral-values-behind-its-ai-bot-2023-05-09/ |url-status=live }} | Jared Kaplan }} | hq_location = [[San Francisco]], [[California]], U.S. | products = Claude | num_employees = 160 (July 2023) | website = {{URL|https://anthropic.com/}} }} '''Anthropic PBC''' is an American [[artificial intelligence]] (AI) [[startup company]], founded by former members of [[OpenAI]].{{Cite web |title=ChatGPT must be regulated and A.I. 'can be used by bad actors,' warns OpenAI's CTO |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/artificial-intelligence-must-regulated-warns-204546351.html |access-date=2023-02-06 |work=Fortune |via=finance.yahoo.com |date=5 February 2023 |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-02-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230206075725/https://finance.yahoo.com/news/artificial-intelligence-must-regulated-warns-204546351.html |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |last=Vincent |first=James |date=2023-02-03 |title=Google invested $300 million in AI firm founded by former OpenAI researchers |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/2/3/23584540/google-anthropic-investment-300-million-openai-chatgpt-rival-claude |access-date=2023-02-06 |website=The Verge |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-02-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230206075725/https://www.theverge.com/2023/2/3/23584540/google-anthropic-investment-300-million-openai-chatgpt-rival-claude |url-status=live }} Anthropic develops [[General artificial intelligence|general AI systems]] and [[large language model]]s.{{Cite web |last=O'Reilly |first=Mathilde |date=2023-06-30 |title=Anthropic releases paper revealing the bias of large language models |url=https://dailyai.com/2023/06/anthropic-releases-paper-highlighting-the-potential-bias-of-large-language-models/ |access-date=2023-07-01 |website=dailyai.com |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-07-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230705081904/https://dailyai.com/2023/06/anthropic-releases-paper-highlighting-the-potential-bias-of-large-language-models/ |url-status=live }} It is a [[Benefit corporation|public-benefit corporation]], and has been connected to the [[effective altruism]] movement. {{As of|2023|July}}, Anthropic had raised {{US$|1.5}}{{nbsp}}billion in funding. In September, [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]] announced an investment of up to US$4 billion, followed by a $2 billion commitment from [[Google]] the next month. == History == [[File:Dario Amodei in 2023.jpg|thumb|Dario Amodei, Anthropic co-founder]] Anthropic was founded in 2021 by former senior members of [[OpenAI]], siblings Daniela and Dario Amodei, the latter of whom served as OpenAI's Vice President of Research.{{Cite web |last=Papadopoulos |first=Loukia |date=2023-02-05 |title=Google invests $400 million in Anthropic to battle the power of ChatGPT |url=https://interestingengineering.com/innovation/google-invests-anthropic-battle-chatgpt |access-date=2023-02-06 |website=interestingengineering.com |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-02-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230206075727/https://interestingengineering.com/innovation/google-invests-anthropic-battle-chatgpt |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |title=OpenAI Is Making Headlines. It's Also Seeding Talent Across Silicon Valley |url=https://www.theinformation.com/articles/openai-is-making-headlines-its-also-seeding-talent-across-silicon-valley |access-date=2023-02-06 |website=The Information |archive-date=2023-02-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230206082900/https://www.theinformation.com/articles/openai-is-making-headlines-its-also-seeding-talent-across-silicon-valley |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |title=Daniela and Dario Amodei on Anthropic |url=https://futureoflife.org/podcast/daniela-and-dario-amodei-on-anthropic/ |access-date=2023-02-06 |website=Future of Life Institute |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-02-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230206082901/https://futureoflife.org/podcast/daniela-and-dario-amodei-on-anthropic/ |url-status=live }} The Amodei siblings were among those who left OpenAI due to directional differences, specifically regarding OpenAI's ventures with [[Microsoft]] in 2019.{{Cite web |date=2023-04-07 |title=As Anthropic seeks billions to take on OpenAI, 'industrial capture' is nigh. Or is it? |url=https://venturebeat.com/ai/as-anthropic-seeks-billions-to-take-on-openai-industrial-capture-is-nigh-or-is-it/ |access-date=2023-05-24 |website=VentureBeat |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-05-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230524193007/https://venturebeat.com/ai/as-anthropic-seeks-billions-to-take-on-openai-industrial-capture-is-nigh-or-is-it/ |url-status=live }} By late 2022, Anthropic had raised {{US$|700}}{{nbsp}}million in funding, out of which {{US$|500}}{{nbsp}}million came from [[Alameda Research]]. [[Google]]'s cloud division followed with an investment of {{US$|300}}{{nbsp}}million for a 10% stake, in a deal requiring Anthropic to buy computing resources from [[Google Cloud]].{{cite web |last1=Waters |first1=Richard |last2=Shubber |first2=Kadhim |title=Google invests $300mn in artificial intelligence start-up Anthropic |url=https://www.ft.com/content/583ead66-467c-4bd5-84d0-ed5df7b5bf9c |website=Financial Times |date=3 February 2023 |access-date=4 July 2023 |archive-date=31 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231031102402/https://www.ft.com/content/583ead66-467c-4bd5-84d0-ed5df7b5bf9c |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |date=2023-02-03 |title=Google invests $300 million in Anthropic as race to compete with ChatGPT heats up |url=https://venturebeat.com/ai/google-invests-300-million-in-anthropic-as-race-to-compete-with-chatgpt-heats-up/ |access-date=2023-02-06 |website=VentureBeat |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-02-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230206075725/https://venturebeat.com/ai/google-invests-300-million-in-anthropic-as-race-to-compete-with-chatgpt-heats-up/ |url-status=live }} In May 2023, Anthropic raised {{US$|450}}{{nbsp}}million in a round led by [[Spark Capital]].{{cite web |last1=Hu |first1=Krystal |last2=Shekhawat |first2=Jaiveer |last3=Hu |first3=Krystal |title=Google-backed Anthropic raises $450 mln in latest AI funding |url=https://www.reuters.com/markets/deals/alphabet-backed-ai-startup-anthropic-raises-450-million-funding-freeze-thaws-2023-05-23/ |website=Reuters |language=en |date=23 May 2023 |access-date=2023-07-04 |archive-date=2023-10-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231024235844/https://www.reuters.com/markets/deals/alphabet-backed-ai-startup-anthropic-raises-450-million-funding-freeze-thaws-2023-05-23/ |url-status=live }} In February 2023, Anthropic was sued by Texas-based Anthrop LLC for use of their registered trademark "Anthropic A.I."{{Cite web |last=Setty |first=Riddhi |date=2023-02-23 |title=Anthropic A.I. Sues AI Company for Trademark Infringement |url=https://news.bloomberglaw.com/ip-law/anthropic-a-i-sues-ai-company-for-trademark-infringement |access-date=2023-02-23 |website=Bloomberg Law |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-02-22 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230222172208/https://news.bloomberglaw.com/ip-law/anthropic-a-i-sues-ai-company-for-trademark-infringement |url-status=live }} [[Kevin Roose]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'' described the company as the "Center of A.I. Doomerism". He reported that some employees "compared themselves to modern-day [[Robert Oppenheimer]]s".{{cite web |last1=Roose |first1=Kevin |title=Inside the White-Hot Center of A.I. Doomerism |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/07/11/technology/anthropic-ai-claude-chatbot.html |website=The New York Times |access-date=13 July 2023 |date=11 July 2023 |archive-date=12 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230712235416/https://www.nytimes.com/2023/07/11/technology/anthropic-ai-claude-chatbot.html |url-status=live }} Journalists often connect Anthropic with the [[effective altruism]] movement; some founders and team members were part of the community or at least interested in it. One of the investors of Series B round was [[Sam Bankman-Fried]] of the cryptocurrency exchange [[FTX]] that [[Bankruptcy of FTX|collapsed]] in 2022.{{cite web |last1=Matthews |first1=Dylan |title=The $1 billion gamble to ensure AI doesn't destroy humanity |url=https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/23794855/anthropic-ai-openai-claude-2 |website=Vox |access-date=23 July 2023 |language=en |date=17 July 2023 |archive-date=3 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231003205441/https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/23794855/anthropic-ai-openai-claude-2 |url-status=live }} On September 25, 2023, [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]] announced a partnership, with Amazon becoming a minority [[Stakeholder (corporate)|stakeholder]] by investing up to US$4 billion, including an immediate investment of $1.25bn. As part of the deal, Anthropic would use [[Amazon Web Services]] (AWS) as its primary cloud provider and planned to make its AI models available to AWS customers.{{Cite news |last=Dastin |first=Jeffrey |date=September 28, 2023 |title=Amazon steps up AI race with Anthropic investment |url=https://www.reuters.com/markets/deals/amazon-steps-up-ai-race-with-up-4-billion-deal-invest-anthropic-2023-09-25/ |work=Reuters |access-date=2023-10-02 |archive-date=2023-11-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231105110524/https://www.reuters.com/markets/deals/amazon-steps-up-ai-race-with-up-4-billion-deal-invest-anthropic-2023-09-25/ |url-status=live }}{{Cite press release |date=2023-09-25 |title=Amazon and Anthropic announce strategic collaboration to advance generative AI |url=https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/company-news/amazon-aws-anthropic-ai |access-date=2023-09-25 |website=US About Amazon |language=en |archive-date=2023-09-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230925104013/https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/company-news/amazon-aws-anthropic-ai |url-status=live }} The next month, Google invested $500 million in Anthropic, and committed to an additional $1.5bn over time.{{Cite news |last=Hu |first=Krystal |date=October 27, 2023 |title=Google agrees to invest up to $2 billion in OpenAI rival Anthropic |url=https://www.reuters.com/technology/google-agrees-invest-up-2-bln-openai-rival-anthropic-wsj-2023-10-27/ |work=Reuters |access-date=2023-10-30 |archive-date=2023-11-02 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231102122701/https://www.reuters.com/technology/google-agrees-invest-up-2-bln-openai-rival-anthropic-wsj-2023-10-27/ |url-status=live }} == Projects == === Claude === Consisting of former researchers involved in OpenAI's [[GPT-2]] and [[GPT-3]] model development, Anthropic began development on its own AI [[chatbot]], named Claude.{{Cite news |title=ChatGPT must be regulated and A.I. 'can be used by bad actors,' warns OpenAI's CTO |url=https://fortune.com/2023/02/05/artificial-intelligence-must-be-regulated-chatgpt-openai-cto-mira-murati/ |access-date=2023-02-06 |website=Fortune |language=en |archive-date=2023-02-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230205233827/https://fortune.com/2023/02/05/artificial-intelligence-must-be-regulated-chatgpt-openai-cto-mira-murati/ |url-status=live }} Similar to [[ChatGPT]], Claude uses a messaging interface where users can submit questions or requests and receive highly detailed and relevant responses.{{Cite web |title=Meet Claude: Anthropic's Rival to ChatGPT {{!}} Blog {{!}} Scale AI |url=https://scale.com/blog/chatgpt-vs-claude |access-date=2023-02-06 |website=ScaleAI |archive-date=2023-02-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230205180325/https://scale.com/blog/chatgpt-vs-claude |url-status=live }} Initially available in closed beta through a [[Slack (software)|Slack]] integration, Claude is now accessible via a website [https://claude.ai claude.ai]. The name, "Claude", was chosen either as a reference to [[Claude Shannon]], or as "a friendly, male-gendered name designed to counterbalance the female-gendered names ([[Amazon Alexa|Alexa]], [[Siri]], [[Cortana (virtual assistant)|Cortana]]) that other tech companies gave their A.I. [[Virtual assistant|assistants]]". Claude 2 was launched in July 2023, and initially was available only in the US and the UK. ''[[The Guardian]]'' reported that safety was a priority during the model training. Anthropic calls their safety method "Constitutional AI":{{cite web |last1=Milmo |first1=Dan |title=Claude 2: ChatGPT rival launches chatbot that can summarise a novel |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/jul/12/claude-2-anthropic-launches-chatbot-rival-chatgpt |website=The Guardian |access-date=13 July 2023 |date=12 July 2023 |archive-date=8 November 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231108182005/https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/jul/12/claude-2-anthropic-launches-chatbot-rival-chatgpt |url-status=live }}
The chatbot is trained on principles taken from documents including the 1948 [[Universal Declaration of Human Rights]] and Apple’s terms of service, which cover modern issues such as data privacy and impersonation. One example of a Claude 2 principle based on the 1948 UN declaration is: “Please choose the response that most supports and encourages freedom, equality and a sense of brotherhood.”
Claude 2.1 has been released in November 2023.{{cite web |title=Introducing Claude 2.1 |url=https://www.anthropic.com/index/claude-2-1 |access-date=21 November 2023}} In the same month, research conducted by Patronus AI, an artificial intelligence startup company, compared performance of Claude2, OpenAI's [[GPT-4]] and GPT-4-Turbo, and [[Meta AI]]'s [[LLaMA#LLaMA-2|LLaMA-2]] on two versions of a 150-question test about information in [[SEC filing]]s (e.g. [[Form 10-K]], [[Form 10-Q]], [[Form 8-K]], [[earnings]] reports, [[earnings call]] transcripts) submitted by [[Public company|public companies]] to the [[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission|agency]] where one version of the test required the generative AI models to use a retrieval system to locate the specific SEC filing to answer the questions while the other version provided the specific SEC filing to the models to answer the question (i.e. in a long context window). On the retrieval system version, GPT-4-Turbo and LLaMA-2 both failed to produce correct answers to 81% of the questions, while on the long context window version, GPT-4-Turbo and Claude-2 failed to produce correct answers to 21% and 24% of the questions respectively.{{cite news|last=Leswing|first=Kif|date=December 19, 2023|title=GPT and other AI models can't analyze an SEC filing, researchers find|publisher=CNBC|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2023/12/19/gpt-and-other-ai-models-cant-analyze-an-sec-filing-researchers-find.html|access-date=December 19, 2023}}{{cite press release|title=Patronus AI Launches Industry-first LLM Benchmark for Finance to Address Hallucinations|date=November 16, 2023|publisher=[[PR Newswire]]|url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/patronus-ai-launches-industry-first-llm-benchmark-for-finance-to-address-hallucinations-301990858.html|access-date=December 19, 2023}} === Constitutional AI === Constitutional AI (CAI) is a framework developed to align AI systems with human values and ensure that they are helpful, harmless, and honest. CAI does this by defining a "constitution" for the AI that consists of a set of high-level normative principles that describe the desired behavior of the AI. These principles are then used to train the AI to avoid harm, respect preferences, and provide true information.{{cite arXiv|last1=Bai |first1=Yuntao |title=Constitutional AI: Harmlessness from AI Feedback |date=2022-12-15 |eprint=2212.08073 |last2=Kadavath |first2=Saurav |last3=Kundu |first3=Sandipan |last4=Askell |first4=Amanda |last5=Kernion |first5=Jackson |last6=Jones |first6=Andy |last7=Chen |first7=Anna |last8=Goldie |first8=Anna |last9=Mirhoseini |first9=Azalia|class=cs.CL }} === Interpretability research === Anthropic also publishes research on the [[interpretability (machine learning)|interpretability]] of [[machine learning]] systems, focusing on the [[Transformer (machine learning model)|transformer]] architecture.{{Cite web |title=Transformer Circuits Thread |url=https://transformer-circuits.pub/ |access-date=2023-02-09 |website=transformer-circuits.pub |archive-date=2023-02-04 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230204224450/https://www.transformer-circuits.pub/ |url-status=live }}{{cite web |title=Towards Monosemanticity: Decomposing Language Models With Dictionary Learning |url=https://transformer-circuits.pub/2023/monosemantic-features/index.html |access-date=10 October 2023 |language=en |archive-date=9 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231009064431/https://transformer-circuits.pub/2023/monosemantic-features/index.html |url-status=live }} == See also == * [[Apprenticeship learning]] * [[AI alignment]] * [[Friendly AI]] == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * {{Official website|https://anthropic.com/}} {{Differentiable computing}} [[Category:2021 establishments in California]] [[Category:AI companies]] [[Category:Artificial intelligence laboratories]] [[Category:Companies based in San Francisco]] [[Category:Public benefit corporations based in California]]
